TopicTitle: Anyone else like the old devonte format better?

Articles.Content: As many of you know, a while ago SQUAD started posting the devnotes in the form of a single article rather than different comments by all the devs.  I like the old way better, as it is easier to skim and pick out the important stuff (less "wordy").  Does anyone else agree?

It's not important, and this method requires only one person to write while the devs can quickly explain to them what they are doing.  Having each dev member write their own synopsis wastes their very valuable time.  Yes I like the old method better, but not at the cost of their time improving the game.

I would agree with Alshain on that. It was nice to get some of the extra details (when there were some) but I'm also okay with the new format. What I like better is that they seem to be adding more pictures with the content.

42 minutes ago, Claw said:

I would agree with Alshain on that. It was nice to get some of the extra details (when there were some) but I'm also okay with the new format. What I like better is that they seem to be adding more pictures with the content.  

We do like those pictures... and when we get them we do like to over-analyze the bejeezus out of them.

Edited December 10, 2015 by Alshain

34 minutes ago, Alshain said:

we do like to over-analyze the bejeezus out of them

Don't get me started. heh
Its like everything they have changed  in the last couple of months I hate it, forums, dev notes etc if its not broke dont fix it

9 hours ago, Alshain said:

We do like those pictures... and when we get them we do like to over-analyze the bejeezus out of them.

Ah, the good ol' 0.25 days. XD
I like this new format as well. It looks cleaner, and is more organized. While there might not be an easy way to find the information you're looking for, the information as a whole is denser.
Still waiting for the "return to old devnote format" petitions.

Jesus Christ. This was a possible debate two months ago. They changed it, there was a bit of crying, but by the next Devnotes everyone had come around to like it. I honestly didn't remember that the Devnotes used to be person-by-person until I saw this thread. Let old debates (or lack thereof) die.
